I'd be happy to help you organize these sources.

Here's a suggested table to help you visualize the relationships between the sources:

**Source Matrix**

| **Source** | **Topic** | **Focus** | **Methodology** | **Findings/Recommendations** | **Relationship to Thesis** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Hirsch (2009) | Language Acquisition Theories | Cognitive, social, and emotional factors | Theoretical overview | Overview of language acquisition theories | Foundation for understanding language acquisition |
| Tennyson (2010) | Instructional Design | ADDIE model | Theoretical overview | Guidelines for instructional design | Framework for instructional design in language acquisition |
| Duff (2015) | Language Acquisition and Development | Cognitive, social, and emotional factors | Theoretical overview | Overview of language acquisition and development | Foundation for understanding language acquisition |
| Graves (2017) | Language Course Design | Task-based instruction, instructional materials, and assessment | Practical guidance | Guidelines for designing language courses | Application of instructional design principles to language acquisition |
| Chang and Chen (2018) | Instructional Design and Language Learning | Meta-analysis of instructional design effects | Quantitative research | Instructional design impacts language learning outcomes | Empirical evidence for instructional design in language acquisition |
| Singh and Sharma (2020) | Cognitive Load Management | Cognitive load management in language instruction | Literature review | Recommendations for cognitive load management | Application of cognitive load theory to language acquisition |
| Shehadeh and Tardy (2016) | Task-Based Instruction | Systematic review of task-based instruction | Quantitative research | Task-based instruction effective for language acquisition | Empirical evidence for task-based instruction in language acquisition |
| Warschauer and Cotten (2017) | Computer-Assisted Language Learning | Review of technology-enhanced language instruction | Literature review | Technology enhances language learning | Application of technology to language acquisition |
| The Modern Language Journal | Language Teaching and Learning | Various topics in language teaching and learning | Various methodologies | Various findings and recommendations | Relevant articles on language acquisition and instructional design |
| ReCALL | Computer-Assisted Language Learning | Technology-enhanced language instruction | Various methodologies | Various findings and recommendations | Relevant articles on technology-enhanced language acquisition |
| Instructional Science | Instructional Design | Various topics in instructional design | Various methodologies | Various findings and recommendations | Relevant articles on instructional design and language acquisition |
| International Journal of Instructional Technology and Distance Learning | Instructional Technology | Technology-enhanced language instruction | Various methodologies | Various findings and recommendations | Relevant articles on technology-enhanced language acquisition |
| The Language Learning Journal | Language Acquisition and Teaching | Various topics in language acquisition and teaching | Various methodologies | Various findings and recommendations | Relevant articles on language acquisition and instructional design |

You can add or remove columns depending on your specific needs. This table can help you visualize the relationships between the sources, their focus, methodology, and findings/recommendations.

If you prefer a mind map, you can create one using a tool like MindMeister or Coggle. Here's a suggested mind map structure:

* Center node: "Instructional Design and Language Acquisition"
* Branches:
	+ Language Acquisition Theories (Hirsch, 2009; Duff, 2015)
	+ Instructional Design (Tennyson, 2010; Graves, 2017)
	+ Empirical Research (Chang and Chen, 2018; Shehadeh and Tardy, 2016; Warschauer and Cotten, 2017)
	+ Cognitive Load Management (Singh and Sharma, 2020)
	+ Technology-Enhanced Language Learning (Warschauer and Cotten, 2017; ReCALL; International Journal of Instructional Technology and Distance Learning)
	+ Journals (The Modern Language Journal; Instructional Science; The Language Learning Journal)
